data.text: @TWillardEdu @RantsWinnipeg @MoriartyLab There's people still dying , The smart people ,  not dummies like me tell us There's a new variant coming . I'll continue doing what I do . I maybe a dummy but I do believe that I have more common sense than Politicians,  and am certainly more honest .
@RantsWinnipeg @jackfish937 @MoriartyLab So, you discount the risks/costs of long COVID?

@jackfish937 @TWillardEdu @MoriartyLab Yeah, cases still exist.  But that's shouldn't be the metric everyone cares about.  ICU Cases, fatalities, hospitalizations.  if the odds of getting seriously ill from omicron is very very very near zero - especially if vaccinated / boosted - then this is a non-issue at this time
@jackfish937 @RantsWinnipeg @MoriartyLab Yes. Then I went on with my evening.
@RantsWinnipeg @TWillardEdu @MoriartyLab Did you read what the woman just wrote ?
@TWillardEdu @MoriartyLab hospitalizations falling, icu cases falling - this virus does not appear to be a major concern any longer.  Sad that we're so addicted to anxiety.
@MoriartyLab @TWillardEdu You help me soooo much. And my daughter who is Type 1. Without your updates and forecasts, we are totally in the dark.

Interestingly, the Province of MB recently acknowledged that they found the first case of BA2 via PCR testing on February 8. Given the undertesting, it has likely been in MB longer. Curious how much of the growth is from that.

@RHCarpentier @TWillardEdu You're right. These are actual reported numbers to date. The test-adjusted cases are modeled, though.

Also, these curves are lagged by 7-14 days because I'm doing 14d averages. Last datapoint probably reflects last week.
